Code: H411

Method of Study: Full-time

Program Description: A specialized Italian culinary and culture program to learn from experts in Canada and Italy.

Context:
The Culinary Arts – Italian postgraduate program is offered at Scuola Internazionale di Cucina Italiana near Parma, Italy, which is known for being one of Italy’s finest chef schools. Students will have the opportunity to study in vineyards, cheese producers, and local markets as their open-air classroom. They will gain experience in some of the best restaurants and hotels in Italy, where they will receive individual attention, training, and inspiring experiences. Upon returning to Toronto, students will showcase their learning at The Chefs' House, George Brown's signature restaurant. This program has a long-standing reputation for excellence among Italian restaurateurs in Toronto and beyond.

The program schedule operates from Monday to Friday. Some classes may begin as early as 7 a.m., and others may run until 10 p.m.

George Brown College provides students with opportunities for work experience in some of the best restaurants and hotels in Italy, as well as self-directed industry work experience within Culinary Management. In addition to formal on-the-job work experience, George Brown also endeavors to provide learning opportunities with real-world challenges and clients.

Career options for graduates include Italian cooking in Toronto, which has a large Italian population and an abundance of Italian restaurants. Graduates may specialize in one of the regional variations of Italian cuisine, leading to a dynamic and varied career.

Required courses for SEMESTER 1 include HOSF 1150: Italian Art and Culture: A Culinary Perspective; HOSF 1151: Italian Language; and HOSF 1152: Fundamentals of Italian Cooking – Theory.

Courses Offered:
- HOSF 1151: Italian Language
- HOSF 1152: Fundamentals of Italian Cooking – Theory and Practical
- HOSF 1153: Dynamics of Italian Food and Wine
- HOSF 1154: Italian Pastry
- HOSF 1164: Italian Externship – Stage (12 weeks)
- HOSF 4016: Italian Culinary Cuisine Concepts
- HOSF 4018: Italian Product Knowledge
- HOSF 1170: The Slow Food Experience
- HOSF 1173: Integrated Marketing Management for Restaurant Operations
- HOSF 1174: Fundamentals of Italian Cooking II – Capstone Evaluation

Semesters and Tuition Fees:
- Semester 2 (ITALY): Starting Fall 2022, Domestic Tuition: $12,537.00, International Tuition: $32,448.00
- Semester 3: Starting Spring 2024, Estimated tuition: $<TBD> (domestic), $<TBD> (international)

Learning Outcomes:
- Create and implement an authentic Italian menu
- Converse in basic Italian and use correct Italian terminology
- Identify, assess, and select appropriate food products for authentic Italian cuisine
- Integrate with Italian culture
- Prepare Italian cuisine within Canadian and EU health, safety, and nutrition regulations
- Develop and present a marketing plan for a restaurant consistent with regional demographics and culture

Additional Costs:
- Uniform: Cost: $<TBD> (not mentioned in text)

Context:
Costs for the program at George Brown College:
- Uniform: $290
- Knives and small wares: $500–$700
- Italian language books and manuals: $150
- Black safety shoes: $110–$160
- Airfare to Italy: approx. $1,400-$1,800
- Visa fee: approx. $75-$85
- Damage deposit for ALMA accommodation: €200 (refundable)
Additional information:
- OSAP funding is available for this program if applicant meets eligibility criteria.
- Program admission requirements: diploma or bachelor's degree in Culinary Management OR one-year certificate in Culinary Skills program or Advanced Cook certification AND one year relevant work experience OR a diploma or bachelor's degree in an unrelated field AND one year full-time relevant work experience.
- English language proficiency test is required for applicants with international transcripts who do not provide English language proficiency test results.
- Students must have valid WHMIS and Sanitation certification prior to the start of the program.
- Allergens including nuts, dairy and shellfish are used in practical labs.
- George Brown College is sensitive to religious observances but may not meet specific dietary laws related to halal and kosher foods.
- International students should check the International Fees and Related Costs page for more information and the International Admissions page for country-specific admission requirements.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Culinary Arts – Italian Program (Postgraduate) H411 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
* George Brown College has a Culinary Arts – Italian program (H411) that is exclusive to Ontario and has an partnership with ALMA Scuola di Cucina.
* The program includes a four-month externship in Italy during the second semester.
* Applications for domestic students should be made through Ontario Colleges.
* International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.
* For inquiries about financial aid and fees, contact the Financial Aid Office at FinAid@georgebrown.ca or visit the Financial Aid web page.
* For general Chef School inquiries, contact CHCAStudentSupport@georgebrown.ca.
* The college can be contacted by phone at 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002, or through international recruitment representatives specializing by country of origin on the International Contact Us page.
* Interested individuals can visit the campus during Discovery Days and sign up for Open House Discovery Day events.
* Related programs offered at George Brown College include Culinary Management (H100), Culinary Skills (H134), and Advanced French Patisserie (Postgraduate) (H413).
